newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat seen one to two cts down on slow export.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat seen one to two cts down on slow export.

text.p: CBOT wheat futures were expected to open one to two cents per bushel lower on Thursday, mostly under pressure from slow export sales, traders said.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture put net old and new crop wheat sales at 423,600 tonnes. That estimate fell below trade expectations for sales of 500,000 to 700,000 tonnes.
Early samples from the ongoing hard red winter wheat harvest in Texas indicate high quality characteristics despite a high moisture content.
Forecasts from the International Grains Council were also seen as slightly bearish for wheat, floor traders said.
IGC slashed its estimate for Chinese wheat imports by three million tonnes to four million for 1997/98.
